intro: Andromachia deppeana, commonly known as the Sierra Madre daisy, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant features showy, yellow-orange flowers with white ray florets, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or dry habitats. Andromachia deppeana is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local pollinators.
